hey guys i have a adapter of fragments `tabBars` and I'm  stuck in a problem my problem is something like this am retrieving an imageFile from an Intent it works fine but when am switching form one tab(Fragment) to another tab then also the `code` is executing which suppose to execute when only my fragment is loaded via  the Intent
how can i make the above code not executable when i switch through the Fragments
and the above code is on my `OnCreate` method
`getActivity().getIntent().getExtras()` is going to return the same bundle from every fragment, assuming they're all in the same activity
yes so this is why am facing this , so how can i stop it from doing this ?  :sweat_smile:
so you have an activity which has some tabs, and each tab loads a fragment, i guess from a viewpager?
yes exactly
am new in android and java so not so familiar with this keyWords
if you only want that code to execute once when the activity loads, put it in activity.oncreate
okay but then from `activity's onCreate`  how can i access the variables of my Fragment ?
i mean how can i access the Frament's variable   from the mainActivty  ?
i don't see you accessing any fields in your fragment in that code block
well, `switch`
`profileImage.setImageBitmap(bmp);` see this is i want to access from my activity
ah
:flushed:
maybe put that `switch` field into your activity instead, then when you load in a fragment from the adapter, pass in the bitmap you're loading
you mean i should change the Value of `Switch` in Activity ?
well it seems to me you're just loading the value from your intent data anyway, which is in the activity
so you might as well keep it at the activity level
the only part I see your fragment needs is that bitmap you're pulling from extras, so you might as well just pass that to the fragment from the activity when you create it

P.S. that code block ^ i usually include as a `newInstance` static method on the fragment class, so whenever you want to create a new instance of that fragment you'll get its arguments bundled properly
:+1: hey thanks
let me try it
thanks a lot
np
:simple_smile:let me try it than i'll let you know
fragments should only ever use getArguments() and setArguments() for moving bundles
additionally you should never put a bitmap in a bundle
ever
bitmaps should be passed by uri or by their original drawable reference
the only reason bitmap is even parceable is for IPC I imagine, definitely not intended to be put into a bundle
yeah that seemed like it could be a bit slow
but i wasn't sure where he was getting the bitmap from
and I take that back.. in IPC the bundle would be used to insert a bitmap but you probably still hit the data size limit
yes that.. absolutely do not do that

this is from where its am getting the Bitmap its an library for cropping the image yeah, i should use the Uri but for that do i have to save the  image first which is inside  this imageView `cropImageView.getCroppedBitmap()` ??
correct you should be saving the image then passing a uri to it
this is one of those ‘just because you can do it does not mean you should'
never pass a bitmap through a bundle
the library provides you a custom ImageView class which crops an image? and from that you're trying to save the cropped version? seems a bit of a hack
it will fail and it will cause you headaches
yes <@U0546QERR>
<@U055GGAHS>: :sweat_smile: any alternatives bro ?
you said it yourself, you would need to save it and pass the Uri
since you're cropping it at runtime with that library
i would think the library should provide some method to give you a cropped bitmap though, instead of having to pull it from the ImageView
okay i'll modify it
maybe they have provided any better options i'll check it out one more time for better alterNative
and thanks <@U055GGAHS>  for suggestions
and thanks a lot   <@U0546QERR> for  your directions and efforts :simple_smile:

Hi, Abhiroop here... 
Need to know something. If notifications are disabled for an app on the device how does gcm handle it?
Or is the handling done on the app side? 
Does the notification manager decide whether to look for the permission and display the notification?
Will gcm still send the notification even if the push permission is turned off?
I tried looking up on stackoverflow and other places. Could not get a clear answer.
<@U0HHCJC6P> you might have to test it out
i think that if the permission is not there it does not get sent to the app
but i could be wrong
<@U0JTGE1N3|dstarnes> has joined the channel

Okay.. I figured that device still receives the notification if the gcm token is valid. It is the notification manager that decides to display the notification or not. 

What I now need to know is whether there's a way to know if push has been disabled for the app.
for your app?
Yes
you will want to read this
<https://developers.google.com/cloud-messaging/gcm>

I've gone through it. My problem is not whether gcm will send the notification or not but if gcm sends the notification how do I check if the notification has been disabled in the settings. This is important since marshmallow allows disabling specific permissions on app install and launch..
<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23573340/how-to-know-if-show-notification-is-disabled-for-my-app>

attachments.title: How to know if Show Notification is disabled for my app?
attachments.text: Is there any way to track whether the user has "Show notifications" disabled/unchecked in the Settings/App Info page of my app?
attachments.fallback: How to know if Show Notification is disabled for my app?

text: there are a couple videos that have the notification lead saying it is not possible
i use urbanairship, so it has been a long time since i have used the notification api directly

Hmm.... But these videos are from 2012. Lot has changed. Especially if you're allowing users to explicitly disable certain permissions, there should something for the developer to know if that feature is enabled or not.
<https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=38482>
with api 23 you can check if the permission is enabled
that is different than checking the notification api
at the bottom is some reflection code that might do the trick
<@U0HHCJC6P>: do you know how to check the permissions?
I saw that code on stackoverflow. Am just not sure about it. Will have to test it rigorously.
yeah
<@U0HHCJC6P> are you guys using your own server solution?

<@U0JLWN2RH> I basically need it to set the status of the notification. Whether it was delivered or not. And in case of no notification allowed set the status as disabled or something. We are supporting api version 15 onwards. Don't think there's a way around it
Set status where ?
